User Story: As a new vendor, I want to create my restaurant profile so that customers can discover my business
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Vendor can enter restaurant name, description, cuisine type
2. Vendor can upload logo (PNG/JPG, max 5MB)
3. Vendor can set operating hours for each day
4. Vendor can define delivery zones on map
5. Profile is saved and visible to customers within 24 hours
6. Email confirmation sent upon profile completion
Edge Cases:
- Logo upload fails (show retry with error message)
- Internet disconnects during save (auto-save draft)
- Vendor leaves mid-setup (save progress, allow resume)
- Invalid image format (show supported formats)
- Special characters in restaurant name

User Story: As a vendor, I want to connect my bank account for payouts so I can receive my earnings
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Vendor can enter bank account details (routing, account number)
2. System validates account via micro-deposits
3. Vendor confirms micro-deposit amounts
4. Payout schedule options displayed (daily, weekly, monthly)
5. Confirmation email sent with payout schedule
Edge Cases:
- Invalid routing number (show error, suggest format)
- Micro-deposits not received within 3 days (resend option)
- Account already linked to another vendor (block with support contact)
- International bank accounts (show unsupported message)

User Story: As a vendor, I want to view incoming orders in real-time so I can prepare food promptly
Acceptance Criteria:
1. New orders appear within 5 seconds of placement
2. Audio/visual notification for new orders
3. Order shows customer name, items, special instructions, total
4. Order timestamp visible
5. Orders grouped by status (New, Preparing, Ready, Delivered)
6. Pull-to-refresh available
Edge Cases:
- Multiple orders arrive simultaneously (queue with timestamps)
- App in background (push notification)
- Internet disconnects (show cached orders, indicate offline)
- Order cancelled while viewing (update status, show banner)

User Story: As a vendor, I want to accept or reject incoming orders so I can manage my kitchen capacity
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Accept/Reject buttons visible on new orders
2. Accept triggers 'Preparing' status and starts prep timer
3. Reject requires reason selection (too busy, item unavailable, closing soon)
4. Customer notified of acceptance within 10 seconds
5. Customer notified of rejection with reason
6. Rejected order refunded automatically
Edge Cases:
- Vendor doesn't respond in 5 minutes (auto-reject, notify vendor)
- Accept pressed but internet fails (retry with confirmation)
- Customer cancels while vendor accepting (show cancellation notice)
- All items in order marked unavailable (suggest rejection)

User Story: As a vendor, I want to mark orders as 'Ready' so drivers know when to pick up
Acceptance Criteria:
1. 'Mark Ready' button visible on Preparing orders
2. Status changes to 'Ready for Pickup' immediately
3. Driver receives push notification
4. Timer shows time since marked ready
5. Customer ETA updates based on ready status
Edge Cases:
- Driver not assigned yet (queue for next available)
- Mark ready accidentally (allow undo within 30 seconds)
- Multiple orders ready at once (batch update option)
- Driver cancels after ready (reassign driver, notify vendor)

User Story: As a vendor, I want to view detailed order information so I can prepare orders accurately
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Tap order opens detail view
2. Shows all items with quantities, modifiers, prices
3. Shows special instructions prominently (highlighted)
4. Shows customer contact info (phone, address)
5. Shows order timeline (placed, accepted, preparing, ready, delivered)
6. Contact customer button available
Edge Cases:
- Special instructions contain allergen info (highlight in red)
- Long item list (scrollable with item count)
- Customer address incomplete (show warning, allow contact)
- Phone number invalid (disable call button, show error)

User Story: As a vendor, I want to add menu items so customers can order from my restaurant
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Add item form with name, description, price, category, image
2. Category selection from predefined + custom categories
3. Prep time estimate field
4. Modifier groups (size, spice level, add-ons)
5. Image upload with preview
6. Item visible on menu after save
Edge Cases:
- Duplicate item name in same category (show warning)
- Price entered as $0 (require confirmation)
- Image upload fails (allow save without image, show placeholder)
- Very long description (show character limit, truncate preview)
- Special characters in price field (validate, show error)

User Story: As a vendor, I want to mark items as unavailable so customers don't order out-of-stock items
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Toggle switch for each menu item (Available/Unavailable)
2. Unavailable items show 'Sold Out' badge to customers
3. Unavailable items grayed out but visible
4. Bulk mark unavailable option
5. Notification to vendor when popular item marked unavailable
6. Option to set automatic re-availability time
Edge Cases:
- Item in active order marked unavailable (allow order completion)
- All items in category unavailable (show category as limited)
- Customer has item in cart when marked unavailable (notify, suggest alternatives)
- Scheduled unavailability conflicts (show overlap warning)

User Story: As a vendor, I want to edit menu item prices so I can adjust for costs or promotions
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Edit button on each menu item
2. Price field editable
3. Price history logged
4. Changes reflected immediately on customer app
5. Option to schedule price changes
6. Bulk price update option (percentage or fixed amount)
Edge Cases:
- Price decreased significantly (confirm not accidental)
- Active orders have old price (honor original price)
- Scheduled price change conflicts (show warning)
- Price set to $0 (require confirmation, flag as promotion)

User Story: As a vendor, I want to organize my menu into categories so customers can browse easily
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Default categories provided (Appetizers, Mains, Desserts, Drinks)
2. Custom category creation
3. Drag-and-drop reordering
4. Category visibility toggle
5. Items can be moved between categories
6. Category images optional
Edge Cases:
- Empty category (hide from customer view)
- Category name already exists (append number or reject)
- Delete category with items (prompt to reassign items)
- Very long category name (truncate with ellipsis)

User Story: As a vendor, I want to view my sales analytics so I can understand my business performance
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Dashboard shows today's orders, revenue, avg order time
2. Trend indicators (up/down vs yesterday/last week)
3. Time range selector (today, week, month, custom)
4. Revenue chart (line graph)
5. Orders chart (bar graph)
6. Top selling items list
7. Export data option (CSV)
Edge Cases:
- No data for selected period (show empty state with message)
- Data still loading (show skeleton/shimmer)
- Very large dataset (paginate or summarize)
- Timezone differences (show vendor's local timezone)

User Story: As a vendor, I want to see my top-selling items so I can optimize my menu
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Top 10 items by order count
2. Top 10 items by revenue
3. Time period filter
4. Compare to previous period
5. Click item to see detailed stats
Edge Cases:
- Tie in ranking (show both, sort alphabetically)
- New item with few orders (indicate 'New' badge)
- Item removed from menu (show as discontinued in historical data)
- Zero orders in period (show message, no chart)

User Story: As a vendor, I want to receive notifications for new orders so I don't miss any sales
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Push notification on new order
2. In-app notification with sound
3. Notification shows order summary (items, total)
4. Tap notification opens order detail
5. Notification settings customizable
6. Do not disturb mode for closed hours
Edge Cases:
- Phone on silent (show visual notification prominently)
- Multiple rapid orders (batch notifications)
- Notification permissions denied (show setup prompt)
- App force closed (still receive push)
- Notification language matches app language

User Story: As a vendor, I want to receive notifications for reviews so I can respond to customers
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Push notification on new review
2. Notification shows rating and snippet
3. Tap opens review detail
4. Badge count on notifications tab
5. Filter reviews by rating
Edge Cases:
- Negative review (prioritize notification)
- Review edited by customer (notify of update)
- Response submitted (confirm notification)
- Review flagged/removed (notify vendor)

User Story: As a vendor, I want to update my store hours so customers know when I'm open
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Edit hours for each day of week
2. Set open/close times with picker
3. Mark days as closed
4. Add break periods (e.g., 2-5pm closed)
5. Set holiday hours
6. Changes effective immediately
Edge Cases:
- Closing time before opening time (show error)
- Currently open, changing to closed now (confirm, handle active orders)
- Holiday conflicts with regular schedule (holiday takes precedence)
- 24-hour operation (allow open = close or dedicated toggle)

User Story: As a vendor, I want to set my delivery zones so I only receive orders I can fulfill
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Map-based zone editor
2. Draw polygon or set radius
3. Multiple zones with different fees
4. Minimum order by zone
5. Estimated delivery time by zone
6. Zones visible to customers during checkout
Edge Cases:
- Zone overlaps another restaurant (allowed)
- Customer address on zone boundary (include in closer zone)
- Zone too small (warn minimum area)
- Zone extremely large (warn about delivery times)

User Story: As a vendor, I want to view my payout history so I can reconcile my earnings
Acceptance Criteria:
1. List of all payouts with date, amount, status
2. Filter by date range
3. Payout details (orders included, fees deducted)
4. Download statement (PDF)
5. Running balance shown
6. Pending payouts highlighted
Edge Cases:
- Payout failed (show reason, retry option)
- Payout delayed (show expected date)
- Dispute on payout (show hold status)
- Very old payouts (paginate, archive access)

User Story: As a vendor, I want to respond to customer reviews so I can address feedback
Acceptance Criteria:
1. View all reviews with ratings
2. Reply button on each review
3. Reply character limit (500)
4. Reply visible to all customers
5. One reply per review (edit option)
6. Reply notification to reviewer
Edge Cases:
- Inappropriate reply (content moderation)
- Reply to edited review (show edit history)
- Customer deletes review after reply (archive reply)
- Very old reviews (still allow reply)

User Story: As a vendor, I want to contact support so I can get help with issues
Acceptance Criteria:
1. In-app chat with support
2. Chat history preserved
3. Support hours shown
4. FAQ/Help center link
5. Escalation to phone option
6. Ticket number for tracking
Edge Cases:
- Outside support hours (show estimated response time)
- Chat disconnects (auto-reconnect, preserve messages)
- Urgent issue (priority flag option)
- Attachment upload (images, screenshots)

User Story: As a customer, I want to browse nearby restaurants so I can find food I want
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Location-based restaurant list
2. Distance shown for each restaurant
3. Delivery time estimates
4. Rating and review count
5. Cuisine type filters
6. Search by restaurant or dish name
7. Sort by distance, rating, delivery time
Edge Cases:
- No restaurants nearby (expand search radius, show message)
- Location services denied (manual address entry)
- Restaurant closed now (show as closed, opening time)
- Very slow internet (cache previous results)

User Story: As a customer, I want to view a restaurant's menu so I can decide what to order
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Menu organized by categories
2. Item photos, names, descriptions, prices
3. Dietary tags (vegetarian, gluten-free, spicy)
4. Popular items highlighted
5. Search within menu
6. Add to cart button on each item
Edge Cases:
- Very long menu (sticky category nav)
- Item out of stock (show sold out badge)
- Restaurant closes soon (show warning banner)
- Price changes while viewing (update silently or notify)

User Story: As a customer, I want to customize my order so I get exactly what I want
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Item detail modal with customization options
2. Required vs optional modifiers
3. Modifier prices shown
4. Special instructions text field
5. Quantity selector
6. Running total shown
7. Add to cart button
Edge Cases:
- Conflicting modifiers (prevent selection, show message)
- Very long special instructions (character limit)
- Required modifier not selected (prevent add to cart)
- Free modifier limit exceeded (show upcharge)

User Story: As a customer, I want to review my cart before checkout so I can verify my order
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Cart shows all items with customizations
2. Edit item option (returns to customization)
3. Remove item option
4. Quantity adjustable
5. Subtotal, fees, taxes, total shown
6. Promo code entry
7. Proceed to checkout button
Edge Cases:
- Item became unavailable (notify, remove from cart)
- Restaurant closed while shopping (show warning, suggest save for later)
- Cart expires (time limit on reserved items?)
- Empty cart (show empty state, suggest restaurants)

User Story: As a customer, I want to complete checkout so I can place my order
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Delivery address selection/entry
2. Delivery time (ASAP or scheduled)
3. Payment method selection
4. Tip selection
5. Order summary
6. Place order button
7. Order confirmation screen
Edge Cases:
- Payment fails (show error, retry option)
- Address outside delivery zone (show error, suggest alternatives)
- Restaurant closes before delivery time (warn, adjust)
- Promo code invalid (show reason)
- Duplicate order detection (confirm intent)

User Story: As a customer, I want to track my order in real-time so I know when it will arrive
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Order status updates (confirmed, preparing, on the way, delivered)
2. Map with driver location
3. ETA countdown
4. Driver info (name, photo, vehicle)
5. Contact driver option
6. Contact restaurant option
Edge Cases:
- Driver location unavailable (show last known, message)
- ETA changes significantly (notify, explain)
- Driver changed mid-delivery (update info, notify)
- Delivery delayed (notify, offer compensation option)

User Story: As a customer, I want to rate my order so I can share my experience
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Post-delivery rating prompt
2. Star rating (1-5)
3. Optional text review
4. Photo upload option
5. Tip adjustment option
6. Reorder button
7. Skip option
Edge Cases:
- Order had issues (link to support before rating)
- Rating prompt too soon (delay until likely consumed)
- Edit rating later (allow within 7 days)
- Multiple orders same day (prompt for each separately)

User Story: As a vendor, I want to create promotions so I can attract more customers
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Create promotion form
2. Discount types (percentage, fixed amount, free delivery)
3. Promo code generation
4. Usage limits (per customer, total)
5. Date range scheduling
6. Target items or entire order
7. Performance tracking
Edge Cases:
- Promo conflicts with another (show warning)
- Promo used beyond limit (enforce, show error to customer)
- Promo expired but still being used (graceful expiration)
- Very high discount (confirm with warning)

User Story: As a vendor, I want to add team members so they can help manage orders
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Invite by email
2. Role selection (Manager, Staff)
3. Permission levels defined
4. Pending invites shown
5. Resend/cancel invite option
6. Remove team member option
7. Activity log per member
Edge Cases:
- Email already registered (show error)
- Invite expired (auto-resend option)
- Remove self (prevent, show error)
- Team member deletes critical data (audit log, restore option)

User Story: As a vendor, I want to see helpful empty states so I know what to do when there's no data
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Empty orders shows illustration + helpful text
2. Empty menu prompts adding first item
3. Empty analytics explains data collection
4. All empty states have CTA buttons
5. Empty states are visually appealing
Edge Cases:
- First-time user (extra guidance)
- Data exists but filtered out (show clear filters option)
- Temporary empty (show different message than permanent)

User Story: As a user, I want clear error messages so I can understand and resolve issues
Acceptance Criteria:
1. All errors have user-friendly messages
2. Technical errors logged separately
3. Retry options where applicable
4. Contact support links for unresolvable errors
5. Offline mode indication
6. Auto-recovery when possible
Edge Cases:
- Network timeout (retry with exponential backoff)
- Server error (show friendly message, log details)
- Validation error (highlight field, show requirement)
- Fatal error (crash reporting, restart prompt)
